results.title: Commonsense a cycle
results.brief_description: Shows the hazard of riding a bicycle in heavy traffic. Shows how foolish riding habits result in accidents and makes an appeal to parents as well as children to see that bicycles are kept in good order and that young children know and obey traffic rules.
results.description: Shows the hazard of riding a bicycle in heavy traffic. Shows how foolish riding habits result in accidents and makes an appeal to parents as well as children to see that bicycles are kept in good order and that young children know and obey traffic rules.

results.title: Common heart disorders and their causes
results.brief_description: The film first reviews the proper functioning of a healthy heart and circulatory system. It then studies common heart disorders giving the history, symptoms and effects of a typical case of childhood rheumatic fever; the assumed causes of hypertension and the effects of each of the conditions which may be caused by arteriosclerosis (hardening of the arteries). Correlated with “Textbook of healthful living” by Dr Harold S. Diehl.

results.title: Common fallacies about group differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
A painter working in a classroom makes a statement about the French race and Latin temperament. A professor, over-hearing his remark, tries to correct his misconceptions. Among other facts, he points out that a nation is not a race, that members of a group are never “all anything”, that group behaviour cannot be judged by isolated cases.

results.title: The Common cold
results.brief_description: Illustrates the facts known about the common cold, its care, and secondary infections that may grow out of it. Tells the story of a boy who contracts a cold and visits his doctor for treatment and advice. Reveals by means of the doctor’s illustrated explanation, why the common cold is serious and how it should be treated.

results.title: Commercial art
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Several years of full-time study requiring imagination, patience and the ability to express ideas in words, as well as in pictures. Stresses that even after training, a job may be hard to find. Shows a young artist in an advertising agency learning to accept criticism of simple jobs, before moving on to more demanding work.

results.title: China: coming of the west
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Institute in America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Chinese History”.
Highlights the confrontation between the ideas and scientific knowledge of modern western civilization and ancient Chinese civilization from the 15th to 20th century. Provides historical background to the early influence of the Jesuit missionaries in feudal China, the 19th century trade treaties of industrial societies such as Britain and America. Colonisation by Japan and Russia in early 20th century is also discussed. Includes archival film including the establishment of the Republic of China in 1912.

results.title: Come see the dolphins
results.creator_credit: Tom Ascher and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a young boy who accompanies his father, a dolphin keeper, to the zoo to see the dolphins. The boy learns of the appearance of dolphins, what they eat and how they communicate and navigate. Skillful photography includes observations underwater and behind the scenes views of equipment and workers needed to maintain the dolphin pool.
